clinical_study.brief_title: Does Sedation Depth (as Evaluated by the Bispectral Index) Influence Dynamic Indices of Preload Dependence?
clinical_study.official_title: Does Sedation Depth (as Evaluated by the Bispectral Index) Influence Dynamic Indices of Preload Dependence? An Observational, Single-centre Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: Dynamic indices of preload dependence (such as stroke volume variability -SVV , pulse pressure variability - PPV and plethysmograph variability index - PVI ) are reportedly predictive of the response to vascular filling in sedated, mechanically ventilated patients. However, the influence of the sedation depth on these dynamic indices has never been evaluated.

primary_outcome.measure: Values of the dynamic indices (SVV, PPV and PVI) at different sedation levels (as evaluated by the BIS)

secondary_outcome.measure: The proportion of patients that change their preload dependence status during a change in sedation depth (as evaluated by the BIS).

arm_group.description: All sedated, intubated, mechanically ventilated adult patients admitted for elective cardiac surgery, monitored for sedation depth (with the BIS) and for preload dependence indices (SVV, PPV and PVI) transthoracic echocardiography

intervention.description: recording of data on cardiac output measured non-invasively by transthoracic echocardiography, including the SVV

study_pop.textblock: All sedated, intubated, mechanically ventilated adult (over-18) patients admitted for elective cardiac surgery, monitored for sedation depth (with the BIS) and for preload dependence indices (SVV, PPV and PVI)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All sedated, intubated, mechanically ventilated adult (over-18) patients admitted for elective cardiac surgery, monitored for sedation depth (with the BIS) and for preload dependence indices (SVV, PPV and PVI)
- Good echogenicity
- Social security coverage
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy, legal guardianship
- Subjects with black skin (a known technical limitation of plethysmography)
- Cardiac arrhythmia
- Sepsis
- Poor echogenicity
